text.0: of one accord with indra o ye rudras come borne on your golden car for our prosperity.
text.1: an offering from us this hymn is brought to you as unto one who th irsts for water heavenly springs.
text.2: armed with your daggers full of wisdom armed with spears armed with your quivers armed with arrows with good bows.
text.3: good horses and good cars have ye o pṛśnis sons ye maruts with good weapons go to victory.
text.4: from hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper in terror at your coming low the woods bow down.
text.5: ye make the earth to tremble sons of pṛśni when for victory ye have yoked fierce ones your spotted deer.
text.6: bright with the blasts of wind wrapped in their robes of rain like twins of noble aspect and of lovely form.
text.7: the maruts spotless with steeds tawnyhued and red strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like heaven.
text.8: rich in adornment rich in drops munificent bright in their aspect yielding bounties that endure.
text.9: noble by birth adorned with gold upon their breasts the singers of the sky have won immortal fame.
text.10: borne on both shoulders o ye maruts are your spears within your arms is laid your energy and trength.
text.11: bold thoughts are in your heads your weapons in your cars all glorious majesty is moulded on your forms.
text.12: vouchsafe to us o maruts splendid bounty in cattle and in steeds in cars and heroes.
text.13: children of rudra give us high distinction may i enjoy your godlike help and favour.
text.14: ho maruts heroes skilled in law immortal be gracious unto us ye rich in treasures.
text.15: ye hearers of the truth ye sage and youthful grown mighty dwelling on the lofty mountains.
